title: Two accounts, settings are the same, one account the mouse movement is different
body:
So I have two accounts and I have made sure that they both are identical in the in-game settings. However, on of my accounts, the mouse movement is different from the other. Its as if mouse acceleration is on or the sensitivity is higher even though the mouse speeds have been set the same. Can anyone help me to figure out why this is, and how I can fix it?

Thanks!

replies.body: I have the same problem, all the settings are the same? Has this happened to anyone else? How do I fix it?

That's really strange to hear that using the same mouse on two different accounts yield different results- if the settings are the same.  Unless the settings on each account are different, through could be a corruption within the configuration of your settings.  I'd suggest resetting your config and re-check your settings to see if that works.

Log into the game client.
Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
Go into a custom game and verify that settings have saved properly.  Leave game to sync settings. 

Let me know if that helps!

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=gtahHVej,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-03-18T17:57:48.199+0000)
>
> That's really strange to hear that using the same mouse on two different accounts yield different results- if the settings are the same.  Unless the settings on each account are different, through could be a corruption within the configuration of your settings.  I'd suggest resetting your config and re-check your settings to see if that works.
> 
> Log into the game client.
> Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
> Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
> Go into a custom game and verify that settings have saved properly.  Leave game to sync settings. 
> 
> Let me know if that helps!

It seems to have worked! Thank you so much for your help!
